intro: Cuphea roezlii, commonly known as the flame flower, is a tropical shrub native to Central America. It is characterized by its striking, tubular red flowers that resemble flames, which bloom throughout the growing season. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving them a velvety texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardens. Cuphea roezlii is also valued for its ability to attract hummingbirds and other pollinators.
